info.title: EZGO API
info.description: EZGO API for CMS, Web and Xamarin clients

get.summary: GetActions -> retrieve actions based on several parameters. (Auth)

parameters.name: filtertext
parameters.description: filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments)

parameters.name: isresolved
parameters.description: isresolved: checks whether is_resolved is true

parameters.name: isoverdue
parameters.description: isoverdue: takes the current date time, adds one day and compares that to the action due date (due date before now+1day)

parameters.name: isunresolved
parameters.description: isunresolved: takes the current date time and compares that to the action due date (due date after now)

parameters.name: hasunviewedcomments
parameters.description: hasunviewedcomments: checks if the actions have unviewed comments for the user obtaining the actions

parameters.name: assignedtome
parameters.description: assignedToMe: returns actions for the 'assigned to me' filter. contains actions whith user in resources or an allowed area for the user in resources

parameters.name: createdByOrAssignedToMe
parameters.description: createdByOrAssignedToMe: returns my actions (either created by current user or action has assigned users containing this user)

parameters.name: createdbyid
parameters.description: createdbyid: checks if the action was created by createdbyid

parameters.name: taskid
parameters.description: taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter

parameters.name: tasktemplateid
parameters.description: taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter

parameters.name: tagids
parameters.description: tagids: checks if any of the tags supplied in this parameter are added to an action (format: 1,2,3)

parameters.name: assigneduserid
parameters.description: assigneduserid: checks if the assigned users contains the assigneduserid

parameters.name: assigneduserids
parameters.description: assigneduserids: checks if the assigned users contains any of the assigneduserids (format: 1,2,3)

parameters.name: filterassignedareatype
parameters.description: Not used

parameters.name: assignedareaid
parameters.description: assignedareaid: checks if the assigned areas contains the assignedareaid

parameters.name: assignedareaids
parameters.description: assignedareaids: checks if the assigned areas contains any of the assignedareaids (format: 1,2,3)

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: timestamp: checks if the created at is before the timestamp (format: dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss)

parameters.name: createdfrom
parameters.description: createdfrom: checks (only if createdto also filled in) if the action was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: createdto
parameters.description: createdto: checks (only if createdfrom also filled in) if the action was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: resolvedfrom
parameters.description: resolvedfrom: checks (only if resolvedto also filled in) if the action was resolved at or after the resolvedfrom, but at or before the resolvedto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: resolvedto
parameters.description: resolvedto: checks (only if resolvedfrom also filled in) if the action was resolved at or after the resolvedfrom, but at or before the resolvedto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: overduefrom
parameters.description: overduefrom: checks (only if overdueto also filled in) if the action was overdue at or after the overduefrom, but at or before the overdueto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: overdueto
parameters.description: overdueto: checks (only if overduefrom also filled in) if the action was overdue at or after the overduefrom, but at or before the overdueto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: resolvedcutoffdate
parameters.description: resolvedcutoffdate: Will not return resolved actions that are resolved before the provided date. Results will include actions resolved on the provided date. (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: checklistid
parameters.description: checklistid: id of the checklist connected to the actions

parameters.name: checklisttemplateid
parameters.description: checklisttemplateid: id of the checklist template connected to the actions

parameters.name: auditid
parameters.description: auditid: id of the audit connected to the actions

parameters.name: audittemplateid
parameters.description: audittemplateid: id of the audit template connected to the actions

parameters.name: rangeperiod
parameters.description: rangeperiod: optional predefined creation date range filter.Supported values: last12days, last12weeks, last12months, thisyear.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: include: possible values are unviewedcommentnr, mainparent, assignedareas, assignedusers, userinformation, tags

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit: limit the maximum amount of actions that this call returns

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset: skip the first x results and return the next limit amount of actions

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

parameters.name: User-Agent-EZ
parameters.description: User-Agent-EZ, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD].  Connected user must have access to one of these apps. Can be used for web applications that can not modify normal user agent information.

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD].  Connected user must have access to one of these apps. Can be used for web applications that can not modify normal user agent information.

401.description: No rights to retrieve the list of actions.

parameters.name: filterassignedareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

post.summary:
AddAction -> Add an action.
The following rules must be met:
- The company that is connected to the action must be the company that executes the check.
- The userId that created the item is the same user that executes the check (unless ignoreUserIdCheck is true).
- The Comment should be filled and can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled.
- The Description can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled
- The Images should contain valid media UriParts
- The Videos should contain valid media UriParts
- The VideoThumbnails should contain valid media UriParts (Auth)

requestBody.description: ActionAction object, containing all data for that specific action.

403.description: Forbidden, no rights to process the action, company id possibly invalid.

post.summary:
AddAction -> Add an action.
The following rules must be met:
- The company that is connected to the action must be the company that executes the check.
- The userId that created the item is the same user that executes the check (unless ignoreUserIdCheck is true).
- The Comment should be filled and can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled.
- The Description can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled
- The Images should contain valid media UriParts
- The Videos should contain valid media UriParts
- The VideoThumbnails should contain valid media UriParts (Auth)

get.summary:
GetActionsHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

get.summary:
GetAreasHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: timespantype
parameters.description:
TimespanTypeEnum; TimespanEnum contains timespans based on days.
With the exception of Today and ThisYear must be dynamically converted.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

GetAssessmentsHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

ScoreTypeEnum; is used within Audits. ScoreType is a lowercase string in the database. In the API we will use this Enum.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

post.summary: Validates the provided IP address list for login authentication. (Auth)
post.description:
This method requires the caller to be authenticated and authorized. It checks the
            validity of the provided IP address list against the user's company and login authentication rules. If no IP
            list is provided, the callers IP address is retrieved and validated.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: timespantype
parameters.description:
TimespanTypeEnum; TimespanEnum contains timespans based on days.
With the exception of Today and ThisYear must be dynamically converted.

get.summary: GetComments -> retrieve comments based on several parameters. (Auth)

parameters.name: filtertext
parameters.description: filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments)

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: userid: the user that created the comment

parameters.name: taskid
parameters.description: taskid: the id of the task linked to this comment

parameters.name: tasktemplateid
parameters.description: tasktemplateid: the id of the tasktemplate linked to this comment

parameters.name: tagids
parameters.description: tagids: checks if any of the tags supplied in this parameter are added to an action (format: 1,2,3)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit: limit the maximum amount of comments that this call returns

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset: skip the first x results and return the next limit amount of comments

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: include: the only include value that is supported for comments is 'tags'

parameters.name: createdfrom
parameters.description: createdfrom: checks (only if createdto also filled in) if the comment was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: createdto
parameters.description: createdto: checks (only if createdfrom also filled in) if the comment was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: timestamp: checks if the comment date is before the timestamp (format: dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss)

parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

get.summary:
GetVersion; get version of application assembly.
Version: [major].[minor].[yyMM].[ddHH(mm rounded)]
e.g. when it's 21th of march 2020 15:33
The minor version = 1
The major version = 2
The total version will be 2.1.2003.21153 (Auth roles: superuser,staff)

get.summary:
FixDataActionCommentActionResolved; Fixed the action comment that were missing and not send. This route needs to be called with an administrator user and called until no-more items are updated. 
When this happens it should return a 410 (resource gone) and as message 0. Until then it should return an OK and result he number of inserted records. Records are added by 100 items per call. (Auth roles: superuser,staff)

get.summary:
This is a fix for auditing records of audit templates where the audit template was deleted (set inactive).
Fixes original object json in data auditing records where the original object json is not the audit template.
Fixes 100 records, if the returned value is less than 100, that means all targetted records are now fixed.
Can be run again but would have no effect and return 0. (Auth roles: superuser,staff)

get.summary:
This is a fix for auditing records of work instruction items where the original object was never logged.
Fills original object json in data auditing records where the original object json is empty with the mutated object of the previous recorded mutation.
Fixes 100 records, if the returned value is less than 100, that means all targetted records are now fixed.
Can be run again but would have no effect and return 0. (Auth roles: superuser,staff)

post.summary: Sets the value of a property for the current user and company. (Auth)
post.description:
This method validates the provided property data, ensuring it is associated with the
            current user and company. If the property already exists, its value is updated; otherwise, a new property
            value is added.

post.summary: Clears functional locations, and all related data, for the specified companies. (Auth)
post.description:
This method requires the caller to have appropriate permissions to clear functional
            locations. The operation is restricted to users associated with the management company as defined in the
            application configuration.

parameters.name: companyIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of company IDs for which functional locations should be cleared.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

post.summary: Imports functional locations from a CSV file and processes the data for the specified companies. (Auth)
post.description:
The method performs the following steps: <list type="number"><item><description>Validates the user's permissions to perform the import.</description></item><item><description>Validates the file format and size.</description></item><item><description>Parses the
            CSV file, removes duplicate entries, and converts the data into models.</description></item><item><description>Imports the functional locations into the database for the specified
            companies.</description></item></list> If the import fails, an appropriate error message is
            returned.

parameters.name: companyIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of company IDs for which the functional locations should be imported.

parameters.name: recalculateTreeStructure
parameters.description:
A boolean value indicating whether the tree structure of the functional locations should be recalculated
            after import. The default value is true.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD].  Connected user must have access to one of these apps. Can be used for web applications that can not modify normal user agent information.

file.description: The CSV file containing functional location data. The file must be in a supported CSV format.

post.summary: Recalculates the functional locations tree structure for the specified companies. (Auth)
post.description:
This operation requires the user to have access to the specified companies. If any
            company ID in the input is invalid or cannot be parsed as an integer, a warning is logged, and that ID is
            skipped.

parameters.name: companyIds
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of company IDs for which the tree structure should be recalculated. Each ID must be a
            valid integer.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

get.summary: Retrieves task templates based on a specified timestamp and offset. (Auth)
get.description:
This method interacts with the shift management system to obtain task templates
            relevant to the specified time. It uses the current user's company context to filter the results.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The optional timestamp to filter the task templates. If null, the current time is used.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset in hours to adjust the timestamp. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

get.summary: Retrieves times for the shift, day and week based on the specified timestamp. (Auth)
get.description:
This endpoint fetches times for the shift, day and week associated with the specified
            timestamp. If no timestamp is provided, the current date and time are used as the reference point.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description:
The optional timestamp used to determine the day and week for which shift times are retrieved. If null, the
            current date and time are used.

get.summary: Retrieves extended second-layer statistics for the specified report type. (Auth)
get.description:
This method validates the input parameters and retrieves the corresponding statistics
            based on the specified report type and filters. If the parameters are invalid, an appropriate error message
            is returned.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description: The type of report to generate. Valid values are "tasks", "checklists", "audits", or "actions".

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description:
The timestamp used as a reference point for the statistics, in the format "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss". If not
            provided, the current UTC time is used.

parameters.name: areaid
parameters.description: An optional area identifier to filter the statistics. If not provided, statistics are not filtered by area.

parameters.name: periodType
parameters.description:
The time period for the statistics. Valid values are "last12days", "last12weeks", "last12months", or
            "thisyear". Defaults to "last12days".

parameters.name: templateid
parameters.description:
An optional template identifier. This parameter is only valid when the reportType is
            "audits".

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: User-Agent Field, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD]. Connected user must have access to one of these apps.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: monthrecurrencytype
parameters.description: NOT YET DOCUMENTED

parameters.name: recurrencytype
parameters.description:
RecurrencyTypeEnum; RecurrencyType is the type of recurrency (DB: tasks_taskrecurrency.type).
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

get.summary:
GetTaskRecurrencies; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
TaskStatusEnum; Statuses that are available for a Task.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.description:

schema.description: String value, must contain one or more valid tags for accessing the application [EZ-GO APP][EZ-GO WEBAPP][MY EZ-GO][EZ-GO DASHBOARD].  Connected user must have access to one of these apps. Can be used for web applications that can not modify normal user agent information.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
TaskStatusEnum; Statuses that are available for a Task.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: recurrencytype
parameters.description:
RecurrencyTypeEnum; RecurrencyType is the type of recurrency (DB: tasks_taskrecurrency.type).
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of tasks based on the specified filters and parameters. (Auth)
get.description:
This method supports filtering tasks by various criteria, including area, time span,
            status, tags, and text search. It ensures that only valid combinations of parameters are accepted. For
            example, timespantype cannot be used together with starttimestamp or
            endtimestamp.  If traffic shaping is enabled, the method enforces rate-limiting based on
            the current user's company and task-related settings.

parameters.name: areaid
parameters.description: The identifier of the area to filter tasks by. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: timespantype
parameters.description:
An optional enumeration value specifying the predefined time span type to filter tasks. Cannot be combined
            with starttimestamp or endtimestamp.

parameters.name: timespanoffset
parameters.description: An optional offset value to adjust the time span specified by timespantype.

parameters.name: starttimestamp
parameters.description: An optional start timestamp for filtering tasks. Must be supplied together with endtimestamp. Cannot be combined with timespantype.

parameters.name: endtimestamp
parameters.description: An optional end timestamp for filtering tasks. Must be supplied together with starttimestamp. Cannot be combined with timespantype.

parameters.name: filtertext
parameters.description: An optional text filter to search tasks by name, description, or other relevant fields.

parameters.name: statusids
parameters.description: An optional comma-separated list of status identifiers to filter tasks by their status.

parameters.name: tagids
parameters.description: An optional comma-separated list of tag identifiers to filter tasks by their associated tags.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: An optional parameter specifying additional related data to include in the response.

parameters.name: allowduplicatetaskinstances
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to True multiple instances of Tasks can be returned

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
An optional parameter specifying the maximum number of tasks to return. Defaults to 200 if not
            provided.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
An optional parameter specifying the number of tasks to skip before starting to return results. Defaults to
            0 if not provided.

parameters.name: returnAllSkippableTasks
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true a list with all tasks that are skipable is returned. This parameter can't be combined with the limit, offset or statusids parameters

get.summary:
GetTasksToday; Will return ALL tasks that have a start_at date on TODAY.
Start datetime and end datetime will be calculated based on either the timestamp supplied or based on now server time converted to company timezone. 
If needed specific filters can be used, no filters are required.
This route can be used as a short form, result can also be retrieved on the /tasks route. 

The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. 
Limit 0 or larger that 200 will not be supported. 

The returned data will consist of all tasks, of all types that need to be started/finished today based on the company shift times. 

NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur. (Auth)

parameters.description: WILL BE IGNORED

parameters.description: WILL BE IGNORED

parameters.description: WILL BE IGNORED

get.summary:
GetTasksTypeWeekly; Get all tasks of type weekly

The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. 
Limit 0 or page size larger that 200 will not be supported. 

The returned data will consist of all tasks of type WEEK that need to be started/finished this week based on the company shift times. 
The time frame can be overridden with a start and end time stamp. 

Weekly tasks will map current week for retrieval; Monday till Sunday by default. Shift calculations will be added if needed. 
If you want a specific time-frame use the starttimestamp and endtimestamp. 
All retrieval will be mapped against the task.start_at time. (Auth)

get.summary:
GetTasksMonthly; Get all tasks of type monthly or month

The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. 
Limit 0 or page size larger that 200 will not be supported. 

The returned data will consist of all tasks of type MONTH that need to be started/finished this WEEK based on the company shift times. 
The time frame can be overridden with a start and end time stamp. 

Monthly tasks will map current week for retrieval; Monday till Sunday by default. Shift calculations will be added if needed. 
If you want a specific time-frame use the starttimestamp and endtimestamp. 
All retrieval will be mapped against the task.start_at time. (Auth)

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: tasktype
parameters.description: NOT YET DOCUMENTED

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

get.summary:
GetTaskTemplatesHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: tasktype
parameters.description: NOT YET DOCUMENTED

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

parameters.name: recurrencytype
parameters.description:
RecurrencyTypeEnum; RecurrencyType is the type of recurrency (DB: tasks_taskrecurrency.type).
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

get.summary:
GetUsersHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's.
Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus.
This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

parameters.name: filterareatype
parameters.description:
FilterAreaTypeEnum; Used for setting a filtering setup.
Single = 0; Just one item, based on the supplied AreaId is queried.
RecursiveRootToLeaf = 1; From the root to the leaf AreaId (through parents)
RecursiveLeafToRoot = 2; All items from the leaf to the root AreaId (through children)
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

post.summary:
Shares a work instruction template with other companies.
The work instruction template will be shared in it's current state.
The other companies will get the shared template in an inbox, to be accepted or declined. (Auth roles: shift_leader,manager,superuser,staff)

parameters.name: workinstructiontemplateid
parameters.description: id of the work instruction template to be shared

id.description: Id; Primary key, in other variables and objects usually named as ActionCommentId. DB: [actions_actioncomment.id]

actionId.description: ActionId; Id of linked action object. DB: [actions_action.id]

comment.description: Comment; Contains user input 'the comment'. DB: [actions_actioncomment.comment.id]

companyId.description: CompanyId; Id of the company where action comment belongs to. DB: [actions_actioncomment.company_id] , depending on implementation it can be the linked action's company id; DB: [actions_action.company_id]

images.description: Images; Collection of images (uri parts). References the image columns in the database. For extendability a array is chosen so we can add more in the future without breaking the structure.

video.description: Video; Video uri; containing a linked video.

videoThumbnail.description: VideoThumbnail; Video thumbnail of the linked video (this.Video)

createdAt.description: CreatedAt; Technical created at date time. DB: [actions_actioncomment.created_at]

modifiedAt.description: ModifiedAt; Technical modified at date time. DB: [actions_actioncomment.modified_at]

userModifiedUtcAt.description: UserModifiedUtcAt; Specific date for posting / creating / updating. If supplied this date will be used for the modified_at data in the database. Will be a own column in future development.

userId.description: UserId; UserId that creates the comment. DB: [actions_actioncomment.user_id]

viewedByUsers.description: ViewedByUsers; List of user basic objects containing all users that are linked through the [actions_commentviewed] table.

ActionComment.description:
ActionComment; Comment attached to a certain action. Actions can have one or more comments. Depending on implementation a comment can have a text and one or more media files. 
Database location: [actions_actioncomment]

ActionParentBasic.description:
ActionParentBasic; Basic item for use with actions. 
Basic objects are used for simple datasets and only contain a few Ids and a visual reference (e.g. name or description).
NOTE! this is not meant to be a base class within the API, so don't use it as such within the API.

id.description: Primary key, in other variables and objects usually named as ActionId.

companyId.description: CompanyId; Id of the company where action belongs to. DB: [actions_action.company_id]

createdById.description: CreatedById; Id of the user that created the action;

createdBy.description: CreatedBy; Name of user, based on CreatedById.

taskId.description: TaskId; TaskId where the action is linked to. DB: [actions_action.task_id]

taskTemplateId.description: TaskTemplateId; TaskTemplateId where the action is linked to. DB: [actions_action.tasktemplate_id]

comments.description: Comments; Collection of action comments that are linked to this action based on the DG: [actions_actioncomment.action_id].

lastCommentDate.description: LastCommentDate; Last date where a comment has been posted.

dueDate.description: DueDate; Due date where a action needs to be finished. This is user input. DB: [actions_action.due_date]

commentCount.description: CommentCount; Number of actions comments that are linked to this action based on the DG: [actions_actioncomment.action_id].

images.description: Images; Collection of images (uri parts). References the image columns in the database. For extendability a array is chosen so we can add more in the future without breaking the structure.

resolvedAt.description: ResolvedAt; Resolved at data; User input; DB: [actions_action.resolved_at]

videos.description: Videos; Collection of videos (uri parts). References the image columns in the database. For extendability a array is chosen so we can add more in the future without breaking the structure.

videoThumbNails.description: VideoThumbNails; Collection of video thumbnails (uri parts). References the image columns in the database. For extendability a array is chosen so we can add more in the future without breaking the structure.

assignedUsers.description: AssignedUsers; Collection of basic user items that are linked to this action based on the actions_action_assigned_users table.

assignedAreas.description: AssignedAreas; Collection of basic area items that are linked to this action based on the actions_action_assigned_areas table.

isResolved.description: IsResolved; Boolean if a action is resolved. When true, ResolvedAt should also be filled. DB: [actions_action.is_resolved]

createdAt.description: CreatedAt; Technical created at date time. DB: [actions_action.created_at]

modifiedAt.description: ModifiedAt; Technical modified at date time. DB: [actions_action.modified_at]

unviewedCommentNr.description: UnviewedCommentNr; Comments that are un-viewed for a specific user.

tags.description: Tags; Tags that are added to this action

sendToUltimo.description: SendToUltimo; True if the action needs to be sent to Ultimo (not in database)

sendToSapPm.description: SendToSapPm; True if the action needs to be sent to SAP Pm

ultimoStatusDateTime.description: UltimoStatusDateTime; A DateTime containing when the action was (attempted to be) sent to Ultimo

ActionsAction.description:
ActionAction; Action object (named ActionAction due to usage of the System.Action object within .Net)
A action can have one or more texts (description/comment) and one or more media items attached. Depending on other settings a action can be linked to assigned users or areas.
A action can be stored as a spot on action; Which is a standalone action (no direct link to a task or tasktemplate.
A action can be stored as a action for a task, tasks can be normal tasks (linked with the task or tasktemplate) or linked to a task that is part of a checklist or audit.
Database location: [actions_action].

Announcement.description: Announcement; Announcements for use with announce panels in the clients (CMS)

companyId.description: CompanyId; Id of the company where action belongs to. DB: [companies_area.company_id]

id.description: Id; Primary key, in other variables and objects usually named as AreaId.  DB: [companies_area.id]

level.description: Level; Level based on number of levels deep; DB: [companies_area.level]

score.description:
Type Score:
- Has the score that the user selected
Type Thumbs:
- OPTIONAL NOT NEEDED.

totalScore.description:
Type Score:
- 1 (ignored? is set to MinTaskScore or maxTaskScore...or random?) TODO figure out, data is inconstant.
Type Thumbs:
- MinTaskScore score (Thumb Down) * Weight, MaxTaskScore (Thumb up) * Weight.

AuditRelationStatusScore.description:
Basic score mechanism as used within the database. Currently we only have to update the Score.
-- TASKS
-- Type:Score
-----------------------------------------------------------
-- Score -> Has the score that the user selected
-- TotalScore -> 1 (ignored? is set to MinTaskScore)
-- MaxScore -> MaxTaskScore * Weight
-- MinTaskScore -> minimal value that can be selected
-- MaxTaskScore -> max value that can be selected
-- Type: THUMBS
-----------------------------------------------------------
-- Score -> NULL
-- TotalScore -> MinTaskScore score(Thumb Down) * Weight, MaxTaskScore (Thumb up) * Weight
-- MaxScore -> MaxTaskScore* Weight
-- MinTaskScore -> minimal value that can be with thumb down
-- MaxTaskScore -> max value that can be with thumb up

templatePropertyId.description: TemplatePropertyId; Directly references template property id (e.g. tasks_tasktemplate_properties.id or checklists_checklisttemplate_properties.id or audits_auditstemplate_properties.id).

registeredAt.description: RegisteredAt; the datetime when the property was entered

PropertyUserValue.description:
PropertyUserValue; Property items for checklists/audits and tasks; Contains the user information that a user has filled in;
Depending on implementation this will directly link to the checklisttemplateproperty/audittemplateproperty and tasktemplateproperty structures.

id.description: Id of the property user value

modifiedAt.description: Date and time the value was last modified

registeredAt.description: RegisteredAt; DateTime when the property was registered (can be null)

taskId.description: Optional. Id of the task this property is related to

auditId.description: Optional. Id of the audit this property is related to

checklistId.description: Optional. Id of the checklist this property is related to

PropertyUserValueDTO.description: Simplified property object to use as a data transfer object for the user input related data for properties

PropertyValue.description:
PropertyValue; Property value. Usually part of a property and used as a choice with a property item.
DB: [propertyvalue]

PropertyValueKind.description:
PropertyValueKind; Kind of property, configured in database.
DB: [propertyvaluekind]

RecurrencyTypeEnum.description:
RecurrencyTypeEnum; RecurrencyType is the type of recurrency (DB: tasks_taskrecurrency.type).
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.

RoleTypeEnum.description:
RoleTypeEnum; Roles in the current EZGO application are based on 3 levels. These levels are saved in the DB as a lowercased string.
For the API we will use the RoleTypeEnum to make sure everything is more or less set in stone.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO Api, always use the value (int) for posting.
In the future when the types are extended, extend this enum.

week.description:
Week;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A week recurrence (period) can be set. The occurrence depending on other settings will run every X weeks where X represents this property.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.week]

day.description:
Day;
Used with -> Recurrence type MONTH with Month Recurrence type DAY_OF_MONTH (month specific date)
A day part of a month recurrence (period) can be set. The occurrence depending on other settings will run every Y day of every X months where Y represents this property.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.day]

month.description:
Month;
Used with -> Recurrence type MONTH
A month recurrence (period) can be set. The occurrence depending on other settings will run every X months where X represents this property.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.month]

weekday0.description:
Weekday0;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Sunday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday0]

weekday1.description:
Weekday1;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Monday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday1]

weekday2.description:
Weekday2;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Tuesday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday2]

weekday3.description:
Weekday3;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Wednesday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday3]

weekday4.description:
Weekday4;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Thursday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday4]

weekday5.description:
Weekday5;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK
A bit value containing true or false and representing Friday; On this day of this week the task must occur.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday5]

weekDay.description:
WeekDay;
Used with -> Recurrence type MONTH with Month Recurrence type WEEKDAY (month specific week)
A day part representing the day of week (starting with 1 for Monday ending on 7 for Sunday) that can occur every 1st,2nd,3rd,4th weekday every x months.
e.g. occur every 2nd Monday of every 2 months.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday]

weekDayNumber.description:
WeekDayNumber;
Used with -> Recurrence type MONTH with Month Recurrence type WEEKDAY (month specific week)
A weeknumber part representing the x week that a certain day occurs. e.g occur every X Monday of Every Y Months where X is represented by this property.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.weekday_number]

isOncePerWeek.description:
IsOncePerWeek; Currently ignored for new templates.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.is_once_per_week]

isOncePerMonth.description:
IsOncePerMonth; Currently ignored for new templates.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.is_once_per_month]

startDate.description:
StartDate;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK, MONTH, SHIFTS
Contains value -> a specific date
A startdate can be set with a recurrence. From this start date all calculation will run for generating new tasks.
These that will only be generate from this start date. If a start date is not supplied the creation date will be used for generation.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.start_date]

endDate.description:
EndDate;
Used with -> Recurrence type WEEK, MONTH, SHIFTS
Contains value -> a specific date
A enddate can be set with a recurrence. Tasks will be generation up until this date.
If a end  date is not supplied no end date will be set and generation will occur infinitely.
DB: [tasks_taskrecurrency.end_date]

Schedule.description:
Schedule; Schedule object contains a schedule based on certain properties. Depending on the filled in values and type a date can be calculated.
Specific rules can be found with the implementation if needed. Some will be added here later.

ScoreTypeEnum.description:
ScoreTypeEnum; is used within Audits. ScoreType is a lowercase string in the database. In the API we will use this Enum.
If we need to check something against the database data, use ToString and ToLowercase within the logic to emulate this behavior.
When using for submitting to the EZGO API, always use the value (int) for posting.

SetupCompany.description: SetupCompany; Setup company, used for creating a new company. Based on this object a basic company is setup with a primary administrator.

SetupCompanySettings.description:
Company; Company object. Company is a digital representation of a physical location where all objects are linked to. 
Database location: [companies_company]

id.description: Id; Primary key, in other variables and objects usually named as ShiftId. DB: [companies_shift.id]

start.description: Start: Start time of the shift; DB: [companies_shift.start]

end.description: End: End time of the shift; DB: [companies_shift.end]

Day: Day number; DB: [companies_shift.day]
shifts.day -> 1 t/m 7 -> Sunday ~ Saterday

weekday.description:
Weekday: Weekday number; DB: [companies_shift.weekday]
shifts.weekday -> 0 t/m 6 -> Monday ~ Sunday

areaId.description: AreaId; Shift is linked to this area through its template. DB: [companies_shift.area_id]

shiftNr.description: ShiftNr; Number of shift, represents the shift number on a specific day sorted by the start times of the shift.

Shift.description:
Shift; Contains a shift, multiple shifts per day and company usually exists. Shifts can not have the same start and end dates when they are for the same AreaId.
Database location: [companies_shift].

Stage.description: Stage; A stage in a checklist contains a subset of the checklist items and can be completed within the checklist.

blockNextStagesUntilCompletion.description: When true, the stages after this are blocked and items in those stages cannot be tapped until this stage is completed.

lockStageAfterCompletion.description: When true, the items in this stage cannot be altered once this stage has been completed.

useShiftNotes.description: When true, shift notes can be added when completing this stage. These shift notes can be read by users who continue the checklist afterwards.

UserBasic.description:

Basic objects are used for simple datasets and only contain a few Ids and a visual reference (e.g. name or description).
In this case the name will be a concatted FirstName and LastName and a Picte.
NOTE! this is not meant to be a base class within the API, so don't use it as such within the API.
